title: In Last Weekly Expiry, FII & PRO Have Squared Off 127125 Contracts...
text:
In Last Weekly Expiry, FII & PRO Have Squared Off 127125 Contracts

Stock Market Today – 6th September 2019

In last weekly expiry, FII & PRO have squared off 127125 contracts and carried 179484 contacts for next weekly expiry. Nifty recently made low of 10637 and is currently trading at 10884. Smallcap recent low is 5115 and is currently trading at 5415. If FII & PRO continue to square off its position, then we might see buying in the market otherwise market will continue to trade volatile.

Upcoming Events

1. There has been lots of hope on GST council meeting schedule on 20th September 2019.

2. RBI will announce its monetary policy on 30th Sep 2019 which can be another trigger for the market.

3. On 18th Sep 2019 US Federal Reserve will announce its monetary policy.

Sector Analysis:

Yesterday market ended in a negative note. Infrastructure Construction and Engineering (1.85%), Energy-Oil & Gas (1.59%), Automobiles & Auto Parts (1.25), Metals and Mining (1.24%) and Chemical (1.14%) were the top 5 major sector. Interior Construction (1.67%), Carbon (1.65%), Media-TV and Newspaper (1.60%), Films (1.20%) and Paper (1.19%) were the top 5 minor sector.

Shankara Building Products (19.06%), Kiri Industries (17.22%), Minda Corporation (9.45%), Hindustan Copper (7.31%) and Bombay Burmah Trading Corporation (6.93%) were the top 5 companies.

The US 10 Year T-Note is trading at 131.26. The Bond has crucial support at 117.42 made on 5th Nov 2018. The US Dollar Index is trading at 98.343.

Market Guru’s Stock Picks

James Derrick Slater or Jim Slater, (13 March 1929 – 18 November 2015) was a British accountant, investor and business writer. Slater rose to prominence in the 1970s as a businessman and financier, who was the founding Chairman of Slater Walker, an investment bank and conglomerate. As a corporate raider in the 1960s and 1970s he grew his investment vehicle Slater Walker to be worth more than £200m, only to see his empire implode during the mid-1970s property and banking crash. He went on to rebuild his fortune. But among private investors, he was best known as a stock market guru, both as a spectacularly successful share tipster for The Times (in the two years from the launch of his column in 1963, his tips gained nearly 70%, compared to less than 4% for the wider market, reports The Daily Telegraph) and as a writer of several books on investing, most notably The Zulu Principle: Making Extraordinary Profits from Ordinary Shares. The Zulu Principle: Making Extraordinary Profits from Ordinary Shares is an investment guide written by Jim Slater and was first published in 1992. He gives valuable selective criteria for buying dynamic growth shares, turnarounds, cyclicals, shells and leading shares in his book. Jim Slater along with his son Mark Slater, launched the MFM Slater Growth Fund in 2005. A relatively concentrated portfolio of between 25 and 50 stocks, primarily UK listed companies. The fund adopts the ‘tried and tested’ investment approach based on the Zulu Principle of 20 years ago. Jim Slater was one of the UK's most popular home-grown investors and his strategy is well followed.

Dynamic Equities has created a strategy based on his philosophy and has found some great stocks to invest in the Indian Stock market. His philosophy revolves around good fundamental parameters such as PE Ratio, Peg Ratio, Price Performance, ROCE, Net Profit & Market Cap.
